description: Internal unique identifier for the asset record within the system.
Organization-assigned fleet identifier used to track the asset across operations and maintenance.
Owning or managing organization responsible for the asset.
Reference to the finance or fixed-asset system record; likely a GL or asset tag number; confirm with SME.
Current lifecycle state of the asset (e.g., active, out of service, disposed).
Model or manufacture year of the asset.
Manufacturer or brand of the asset.
Manufacturer’s model or equipment designation for the asset.
Fleet class/category code used for grouping similar asset types.
Registered license plate number assigned to the asset.
State where the asset is registered or primarily operated.
Manufacturer-assigned vehicle identification number or serial number for the asset.
Code for the department that owns or uses the asset.
Description of the department that owns or uses the asset.
Code for the maintenance shop responsible for servicing the asset.
Description of the maintenance shop responsible for the asset.
Planned availability of the asset, likely hours per day or service window; confirm with SME.
Primary exterior color of the asset.
Gross vehicle weight or rating (GVW/GVWR) for the asset; units may be pounds or kilograms; confirm with SME.
Code representing the drivetrain configuration (e.g., 2WD, 4WD); confirm with SME.
Description of the drivetrain configuration.
Serial number of the asset’s body or upfit component, if applicable.
Serial number of the chassis/frame component, distinct from body or engine serials.
Primary site or facility where the asset is based; confirm definition with SME.
Specific location or yard assignment for the asset within the site.
Postal code for the asset’s assigned site or location.
Free-text operational notes, such as status changes, sales, or important history.
Vendor- or manufacturer-assigned identifier used on supplier records; confirm usage with SME.
Fuel card number assigned to the asset for fueling transactions and controls.
Priority level for maintenance, assignment, or response; lower numbers may indicate higher priority; confirm with SME.
Code for a monitoring or telematics grouping of assets; confirm with SME.
Description of the monitoring group to which the asset belongs.
Code indicating the asset’s usage category or business unit.
Description of the asset’s usage category or business unit.
Date the asset was placed into active service.
Date the asset was acquired by the organization.
Total acquisition cost of the asset in local currency.
Vehicle title number or ownership document reference; confirm intended use with SME.
Method of acquisition, such as owned, leased, or rented.
Identifier of the previous asset that this one replaced, if applicable.
Planned useful life of the asset, in months, for lifecycle and depreciation planning.
Primary fuel type used by the asset.
Capacity of the primary fuel tank.
Unit of measure for the primary fuel capacity.
Secondary fuel type or additive used by the asset, if any.
Capacity of the secondary fuel tank or reservoir.
Unit of measure for the secondary fuel capacity.
Engine displacement or power rating; units and format may vary; confirm with SME.
Manufacturer’s serial number assigned to the engine.
Engine oil capacity; unit of measure not specified; confirm with SME.
Type of the primary usage meter, such as miles or hours.
Most recent recorded value of the primary meter.
Target end-of-life threshold for the primary meter.
Primary meter reading at the time of acquisition or commissioning.
Date the primary meter’s acquisition reading was recorded.
Life-to-date accumulated value for the primary meter.
Type of the secondary usage meter, typically hours or miles.
Most recent recorded value of the secondary meter.
Target end-of-life threshold for the secondary meter.
Secondary meter reading at the time of acquisition or commissioning.
Date the secondary meter’s acquisition reading was recorded.
Life-to-date accumulated value for the secondary meter.
Type of the tertiary usage meter, if used; confirm with SME.
Most recent recorded value of the tertiary meter, if tracked.
Target end-of-life threshold for the tertiary meter, if applicable.
Tertiary meter reading at acquisition or commissioning.
Date the tertiary meter’s acquisition reading was recorded.
Life-to-date accumulated value for the tertiary meter.
Transmission specification or type (e.g., automatic, manual, model family).
Transmission or system fluid capacity; unit of measure not specified; confirm with SME.
Manufacturer’s serial number assigned to the transmission.
First name of the primary contact responsible for the asset.
Middle initial of the primary contact, if available.
Last name of the primary contact responsible for the asset.
Email address for the asset’s primary contact.
Phone number for the asset’s primary contact.
Flag indicating whether the contact receives preventive maintenance email notifications.
Meter type used to schedule a 15‑point inspection or PM program; confirm with SME.
Assumed annual inflation rate used for lifecycle cost planning, expressed as a percentage.
Expected salvage value as a percentage of acquisition cost for lifecycle modeling.
Cumulative funds collected or reserved toward the asset’s replacement; currency not specified; confirm with SME.
Subject line or category for the associated note entry.
Free-text note capturing asset details, history, or special instructions.
